definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: Have you ever laughed at those people with disabilities?
sentences.chinese: 你曾經嘲笑過那些殘廢人嗎？

sentences.english: The disabled man is able to enable vegetables to grow on specially established tables.
sentences.chinese: 那個殘廢人能讓蔬菜在特殊放置的桌子上生長。

sentences.english: I've been on disability pay ever since the accident.
sentences.chinese: 自從那次事故我就享受殘廢人待遇了。

sentences.english: His uncle was disabled in the civil war, he lost his left arm.
sentences.chinese: 他的叔父在內戰中失去了一條左臂，成了殘廢人。

sentences.english: Don't waste your time, or time will waste you.
sentences.chinese: 不要浪費時間，否則時間會把你變成廢人。

sentences.english: Physically, I was a total wreck.
sentences.chinese: 從身體上說，我完全是一個廢人。

sentences.english: A: To help the handicapped people recover physically and mentally.
sentences.chinese: 幫助殘廢人從身體和心理上都得到康復。

sentences.english: He will become a social basket?
sentences.chinese: 他會成爲社會的廢人嗎？

sentences.english: The stroke left him a helpless.
It makes people kind of uncomfortable to have a cripple around.
sentences.chinese: 有個殘廢人在場，四周的人都會感到不舒服。

sentences.english: He becomes a maimed man with all one's life.
sentences.chinese: 他將終生成爲一個殘廢人。

sentences.english: I'm not handicapped anymore - I am helping someone else.
sentences.chinese: 我不再是廢人了，我也能幫助別人。

sentences.english: The stroke left him a helpless wreck.
sentences.chinese: 他患中風之後成了不能自理的廢人。

sentences.english: Without my rifle, I am useless.
A: Look! So many handicapped people.

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to force someone to do something
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
